intro: Pedicularis gypsicola, commonly known as the gypsum beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the arid and rocky regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils, often found on limestone or gypsum outcrops. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive beard-like structure at the base of the throat. Pedicularis gypsicola is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
